alert.note: Alert for Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 19 at 2:52PM MDT until March 23 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM MONDAY TO 6 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 36 inches. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Upper Rio Grande Valley/Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Feet. * WHEN...From 9 AM Monday to 6 AM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will be a long duration winter storm, and at times the snow will be quite heavy while at other times the snow will only be light to moderate. The heaviest snow is expected Monday Night through Tuesday Morning, and then again Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft
